intro: Alepidocline trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellow, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. It is a perennial herb that produces slender, branched stems and small, capsule-like fruits. Alepidocline trifida is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of the Northern Hemisphere.
